com.twitterapime.search
Class TrendTopics

java.lang.Object
  com.twitterapime.search.TrendTopics

public final class TrendTopics
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides methods for searching for trend topics. 

 TrendTopics tt = TrendTopics.getInstance();
 Query q1 = QueryComposer.date(new Date());
 Topic[] ts = tt.searchDailyTopics(q);
 for (int i = 0; i < ts.length; i++) {
   list.append(ts[i].getString(MetadataSet.TOPIC_TEXT), null);
 }

Since:
1.5
Version:
1.1
Author:
Ernandes Mourao Junior (ernandes@gmail.com)

Method Detail

getInstance

public static TrendTopics getInstance()
Deprecated. Twitter API v1.1 now requires authentication for all methods.

Returns:
TrendTopics single instance.

setServiceURL

public void setServiceURL(java.lang.String serviceKey,
                          java.lang.String url)

Set a new URL to a given Twitter API service. This method is very useful in case Twitter API decides to change a service's URL. So there is no need to wait for a new version of this API to get it working back.

Be careful about using this method, since it can cause unexpected results, case you enter an invalid URL.

Parameters:
serviceKey - Service key.
url - New URL.
See Also:
TWITTER_API_URL_SERVICE_TRENDS_WOEID, TWITTER_API_URL_SERVICE_TRENDS_DAILY, TWITTER_API_URL_SERVICE_TRENDS_WEEKLY

searchNowTopics

public Topic[] searchNowTopics(Query query)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               LimitExceededException
Deprecated. No longer available in Twitter API v1.1.

Get most recent topics in the world.

In order to create the query, only the following methods can be used as filters:

  • QueryComposer.excludeHashtags()

Parameters:
query - The filter query. If null all topics are returned.
Returns:
Most recent topics.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
LimitExceededException - If the limit of access is exceeded.

searchNowTopics

public Topic[] searchNowTopics(java.lang.String woeid,
                               Query query)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               LimitExceededException
Deprecated. No longer available in Twitter API v1.1.

Get most recent topics from a given location on earth.

In order to create the query, only the following methods can be used as filters:

  • QueryComposer.excludeHashtags()

Parameters:
woeid - Yahoo! Where On Earth ID.
query - The filter query. If null all topics are returned.
Returns:
Most recent topics.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
LimitExceededException - If the limit of access is exceeded.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If woeid is null/empty.

searchDailyTopics

public Topic[] searchDailyTopics(Query query)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 LimitExceededException
Deprecated. No longer available in Twitter API v1.1.

Get daily topics.

In order to create the query, only the following methods can be used as filters:

  • QueryComposer.date(java.util.Date)
  • QueryComposer.excludeHashtags()

Parameters:
query - The filter query. If null all topics are returned.
Returns:
Daily topics.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
LimitExceededException - If the limit of access is exceeded.

                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  LimitExceededException
Deprecated. No longer available in Twitter API v1.1.

Get weekly topics.

In order to create the query, only the following methods can be used as filters:

  • QueryComposer.excludeHashtags()

Parameters:
query - The filter query. If null all topics are returned.
Returns:
Weekly topics.
Throws:
